Error.Message: The operation failed due to an internal error.
Error.PossibleCauses: The operation failed due to an internal error.
Error.RecommendedAction: Retry the operation. If the issue persists, contact support.

Error.Message: The operation failed due to an internal error.
Error.RecommendedAction: Retry the operation. If the issue persists, contact support.

Error.Message: The operation failed due to an internal error.
Error.RecommendedAction: Retry the operation. If the issue persists, contact support.

Error.Message: Set up of appliance failed as service '%ComponentServiceName;' health check failed with error '%ErrorLabel;'('%ErrorCodeName;').
Error.PossibleCauses: 1. Proxy settings are incorrectly configured on the ASR replication appliance. 2. Firewall or network security provider is blocking the access to the required URLs. 3. There is a no network connectivity or the required URLs are not accessible from the ASR replication appliance. 4. There is a time synchronization error.
Error.RecommendedAction: 1. Ensure that the proxy settings are configured properly. 2. Resolve the proxy or network security provider or firewall configurations to allow connection to the URLs mentioned in the below registry keys of HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows Azure Backup\Config\InMageMT path. a. AADAuthority b. ProtectionServiceSVCEndpoint 3. Fix the system time on the appliance. 4. Retry the operation after fixing the error. Please reach out to Microsoft Support for further assistance.

Error.Message: Microsoft Recovery services agent service '%Service;' is not running.
Error.PossibleCauses: Microsoft Recovery services agent service '%Service;' is not running.
Error.RecommendedAction: Navigate to services.msc and ensure the service 'Microsoft Azure Recovery Services Agent' is not disabled and is in running state.

Error.Message: Microsoft Recovery services agent service '%Service;' is not installed.
Error.PossibleCauses: Microsoft Recovery services agent service '%Service;' is not installed.
Error.RecommendedAction: Ensure that the service 'Microsoft Azure Recovery Services Agent' is installed.

Error.Message: Microsoft Recovery services agent service '%Service;' is in disabled state.
Error.PossibleCauses: Microsoft Recovery services agent service '%Service;' is in disabled state.
Error.RecommendedAction: Navigate to services.msc and search for the service '%ServiceName;'. Ensure that it is not disabled. If it is, then turn it on.
